alert.note: Alert for Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 2:31PM CDT until May 19 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Cypress Creek at Katy-Hockley Road affecting Waller and Harris Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Fort Bend, Wharton and Brazoria Counties. ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Texas... Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. .Additional rainfall is possible which could lead to increases in stage levels. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Sendera Ranch Road, Humble...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Cypress Creek...including Katy-Hockley Road...Minor flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including Boling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...West Fork San Jacinto near Humble. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 50.3 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins as homes on Lake Point Drive in the Northshore subdivision begin flooding and roads in the Bellaeu Woods subdivision are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 47.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 50.2 feet late Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 49.3 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 50.2 feet on 01/04/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed West Fork San Jacinto Humble 49.3 47.0 Sun 12 pm CD 49.8 50.1 50.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.
